pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:5.1: 55. The training rule on with food
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Bhagga country at Susumāragira in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the deer park.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:6.2: At that time monks in the Kokanada stilt house received the drinking-water vessel with hands soiled with food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:6.4: “How could the Sakyan ascetics receive the drinking-water vessel with hands soiled with food? They are just like lay people who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.1: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.2: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.3: “How can those monks receive the drinking-water vessel with hands soiled with food?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that they do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.7: How can those foolish men receive the drinking-water vessel with hands soiled with food?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:7.9: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:8.1: ‘“I will not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:9.1: One should not receive the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect receives the drinking-water vessel with a hand soiled with food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:10.6: if he receives it with the intention of afterwards washing it or getting it washed;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:10.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk55:11.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
